summary: The document is an agent report from the 108th CIC Group, dated August 20, 1958, focusing on Robert Scheer, a pre-inductee. It outlines an investigation into Scheer's employment at S. Klein Department Stores in New York, detailing his roles as a stock clerk and cashier, salary progression, reason for departure, and educational background. Challenges in locating former colleagues due to high turnover were noted.
key_findings: Robert Scheer was employed at S. Klein Department Stores from June 8, 1954, to October 4, 1954, holding positions as a stock clerk and cashier.
His starting salary was $32.00 per week, which increased to $34.00 after a week.
Scheer's employment ended due to a reduction in force.
The investigation faced difficulties in finding former supervisors or co-workers because of the store's high employee turnover.
Educational details include attendance at PS 96 and Christopher Columbus High School in the Bronx, and Queens College in Flushing, New York.
